pullRequest.body:
Prove the Erdős–Ginzburg–Ziv theorem as a corollary of Chevalley-Warning. This theorem states that among any (not necessarily distinct) `2 * n - 1` elements of `ZMod n`, we can find `n` elements of sum zero.

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

bors d+
LGTM!
LGTM!
bors d+
This looks like it belongs with `recOnPrimeCoprime`, and probably proved using things there.
Isn't there an instance from Fact Prime to AtLeastTwo which can help you here? If not, how about using `Prime.one_lt'` instead?
I don't think I should be relying on obscure machinery for such simple statements. I also don't see how `(Nat.Prime.one_lt' p).out` is better than `(Fact.out : p.Prime).two_le`
Since the informal versions use the term 'sequence', let's also have a list/multiset version (of course derived from these).
Does the informal "sequence" really mean the formal `Multiset`?
That's why I offered List instead :) In any case, my point is that there are other formulations of this statement, and we might as well provide them too.
Yeah but sometimes it's better to force people to use the superior statement. I've added the multiset versions but I'm unsure they are useful
Was this intentionally dropped?
Whoops, no

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: The Erdős–Ginzburg–Ziv theorem
